intro: Corysanthes papa, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. The flowers bloom during the rainy season, often around the holiday period, giving it its common name.
